The prehistoric period is a time long ago, before written records existed. It is a time of discovery, when people first began to live in groups, build homes, and make tools. We know about the prehistoric period from the things people left behind, like old stones, bones, and tools. Archaeologists study these artifacts to learn about how people lived, what they ate, and how they hunted. They also find old human remains and study them to learn more about the people who lived a long time ago. The prehistoric period is divided into different eras, each with its own unique characteristics. For example, the Paleolithic era is a time of early stone tools and hunting, while the Neolithic era is a time of farming and settled communities. By studying the prehistoric period, we can learn about how humans developed and changed over time. It is a fascinating time that helps us understand where we come from.  ## Step 1

We can't read or write, so how do we know about it? Well, we have to look at what's left behind. We find bones and tools that people used. We see pictures on rocks and in caves. We also find old buildings made by people a long time ago. By studying all these things, we can learn about the people who lived before writing. They were just like us, but they didn't have the same things we have today. They had to work hard to find food and shelter. They were good at making things and living in their world. We can learn a lot from them.

Many, many years ago, before we had writing, people lived on earth. We call this time 'prehistory.' During prehistory, people made tools from stone, bone, and wood. They hunted animals for food and built homes to live in. They did not write or leave behind any written records, so we don't know much about their lives. But we can learn about them by looking at the things they left behind, like old tools and homes. Archaeologists study these things to learn about people who lived a long time ago. They try to figure out how people lived, what they ate, and how they interacted with each other. By studying the past, we can learn more about our own lives today. We can see how people have changed over time and how some things stay the same.

"A long time ago, before people knew how to write, there was a time called prehistory. It started about 2.5 million years ago and ended around 4,000 years ago. During prehistory, people lived in small groups and hunted animals for food. They also gathered fruits and plants. People made tools from rocks and wood to help them survive. As time passed, people learned to farm the land and grow their own food. They made better tools and homes. People started to live in bigger groups and make their own clothes. Prehistory was a time of change and discovery. It helped people become who we are today."
